metadata.title: CVE-2021-47423 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/nouveau/debugfs: fix file release memory leak When using single_open()for opening, single_release() should be called, otherwise the 'op'allocated in single_open() will be leaked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-166-generic - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-4.15.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-4.15.0-166-lowlatency - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-166-generic - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-166-lowlatency - 4.15.0-166.174
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1105-kvm - 4.15.0-1105.107
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1118-aws - 4.15.0-1118.125
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1061-aws - 5.4.0-1061.64~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1129-azure - 4.15.0-1129.142
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1065-azure - 5.4.0-1065.68~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-gcp - 4.15.0-1114.128
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1059-gcp - 5.4.0-1059.63~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1085-oracle - 4.15.0-1085.93
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-166.174').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1118.125').
